text: The Cape Fear Memorial Bridge is a steel vertical-lift bridge in North Carolina. It carries US 17/US 76/US 421 across the Cape Fear River between Brunswick County and New Hanover County. It also carried U.S. Route 74 until that designation was shifted to the Isabel S. Holmes Bridge. It features a lift span that can be raised .State Bridge Records Accessed June 30, 2006. The lift span is long. ==History== Construction on the bridge began in 1967 and was completed in 1969. The bridge received new paint in 1986, new decking in 1996, and a new control system in 2007. ==Gallery== File:Under the Cape Fear Memorial Bridge.jpg File:Cape Fear Memorial Bridge (2013).jpg File:WilmingtonAerialViewCoastGuard.jpg File:Cape fear.jpg ==See also== * * * * Interstate 140 (North Carolina) * ==References== ==External links== * Category:Bridges completed in 1969 Category:Buildings and structures in Brunswick County, North Carolina Category:Buildings and structures in Wilmington, North Carolina Category:Vertical lift bridges in the United States Category:Road bridges in North Carolina Category:Transportation in Brunswick County, North Carolina Category:U.S. Route 76 Category:U.S. Route 421 Category:U.S. Route 17 Category:Bridges on the United States Numbered Highways Category:U.S. Route 74 Category:Towers in North Carolina Category:Steel bridges in the United States
title: Cape Fear Memorial Bridge
